alert.note: Alert for Western Essex; Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 6:01PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern King and Queen and west central Essex Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 601 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Saint Stephens Church. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, half inch hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern King and Queen and west central Essex Counties, including the following locations... Biscoe, Owenton, Rexburg, Indian Neck, Dunbrooke and Beazley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Western Essex; Western King and Queen
